briefTitle: A Study of Dulaglutide (LY2189265) in Children and Adolescents With Type 2 Diabetes

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Have type 2 diabetes, treated with diet and exercise, with or without metformin and/or basal insulin. Metformin and/or basal insulin dose must be stable for at least 8 weeks prior to study screening.
* Have HbA1c \>6.5% to ≤11% at screening visit. If newly diagnosed and not on medicine for diabetes, HbA1c must be between \>6.5 % to ≤9%.
* Have a BMI (body mass index) \>85 percentile for age, gender and body weight ≥50 kilograms (110 pounds).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Known type 1 diabetes, or positive GAD65 or IA2 antibodies, or history of diabetic ketoacidosis or hyperglycemic hyperosmolar syndrome.
* A history of, or at risk for pancreatitis.
* Self or family history of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia (MEN) type 2A or B, thyroid C-cell hyperplasia or medullary thyroid cancer, or a blood calcitonin result ≥20 picograms per milliliter (pg/ml) at screening.
* A systolic blood pressure of ≥160 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) or diastolic ≥100 mmHg.
* Active or treated cancer.
* A blood disorder where an accurate HbA1c may not be obtainable.
* A female of childbearing age, sexually active and not on birth control.
* Pregnant or plan to be pregnant during the study, or breastfeeding.
* Taking any diabetic medication other than metformin or basal insulin and have not stopped it 3 months prior to the screening visit (6 weeks for bolus or mealtime insulin).
* Have taken oral steroids within the last 60 days or more than 20 days use within the past year or 1000 micrograms fluticasone propionate per day.
* Using prescription weight loss medications in the last 30 days, or plan to use.
* Taking psychiatric medications for depression or illness or attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) if, the doses has changed within the last 3 months.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) (Pooled Doses) at Week 26
outcomeMeasures.description: HbA1c is a form of hemoglobin that is measured primarily to identify the average plasma glucose concentration over prolonged periods of time. Least square (LS) mean in HbA1c was calculated using a restricted maximum likelihood (REML) based mixed-effects model for repeated measures (MMRM) and adjusted by, baseline + insulin Use + metformin Use + treatment + time + treatment\*time (Type III sum of squares). Variance-covariance structure = unstructured (for actual value) / unstructured (for change from baseline).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c (Individual Doses) at Week 26
outcomeMeasures.description: HbA1c is a form of hemoglobin that is measured primarily to identify the average plasma glucose concentration over prolonged periods of time. LS mean in HbA1c was calculated using a REML based MMRM and adjusted by, baseline + insulin use + metformin use + treatment + time + treatment\*time (Type III sum of squares). Variance-covariance structure = unstructured (for actual value) / unstructured (for change from baseline).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting Blood Glucose (FBG) at Week 26
outcomeMeasures.description: Fasting blood glucose is a test to determine how much glucose (sugar) is in a blood sample after an overnight fast. Least squares (LS) means were calculated using a mixed-effects model for repeated measures (MMRM) analysis and adjusted by baseline, strata, treatment, time, treatment\*time, (Type III sum of squares). Variance-Covariance structure = Unstructured (for actual value) / Unstructured (for change from baseline). Strata refer to: insulin use + metformin use + baseline HbA1c group \[ less than (\<) 8%, greater than or equal to (\>=) 8%).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With HbA1c ≤7.0%
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of participants was calculated by dividing the number of participants reaching target HbA1c by the total number of participants analyzed, multiplied by 100.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index (BMI) at Week 26
outcomeMeasures.description: BMI is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared. LS mean were calculated using a MMRM analysis and adjusted by baseline, strata, treatment, time, treatment\*time, (Type III sum of squares). Variance-Covariance structure = Unstructured (for actual value) / Unstructured (for change from baseline). Strata refer to: insulin use + metformin use + baseline HbA1c group (\< 8%, \>= 8%).

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Self-Reported Events of Hypoglycemia
outcomeMeasures.description: Summary and analysis of Incidence of all hypoglycemia with Plasma Glucose \<54mg/dL.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Requiring Rescue for Severe, Persistent Hyperglycemia
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of Participants Requiring Rescue for Severe, Persistent Hyperglycemia was summarized.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adjudicated Pancreatitis
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of participants with pancreatitis confirmed by adjudication is summarized cumulatively at 26 weeks. A summary of serious and other non-serious adverse events regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Pancreatic Enzymes at Week 26
outcomeMeasures.description: Serum Amylase (total and pancreas-derived) and lipase concentrations were measured.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Thyroid Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of Participants with Thyroid Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events were summarized.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Serum Calcitonin at Week 26
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from Baseline in Serum Calcitonin was evaluated.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Allergic, Hypersensitivity Reactions
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of Participants with Allergic and hypersensitivity reactions that were considered possibly related to study drug by the investigator are presented. A summary of serious and other non-serious adverse events regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Injection Site Reactions
outcomeMeasures.description: The percentage of participants with at least one treatment-emergent injection site reaction is presented. A summary of serious and other non-serious adverse events regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Anti-Dulaglutide Antibodies
outcomeMeasures.description: Dulaglutide anti-drug antibodies (ADA) were assessed at baseline, Weeks 26 and 56. A participant was considered to have treatment-emergent (TE) dulaglutide ADAs if the participant had at least 1 titer that was TE relative to baseline, defined as a 4-fold or greater increase in titer from baseline measurement.

outcomeMeasures.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Maximum Concentration of Dulaglutide at Steady-state (Cmax,ss)
outcomeMeasures.description: PK: Maximum Concentration of Dulaglutide at steady-state (Cmax,ss) was derived by a population pharmacokinetics approach. As part of addendum, additional PK samples were taken at week 9.

outcomeMeasures.title: PK: Area Under the Concentration Time Curve Over a 1-week Interval of Dulaglutide at Steady-State [AUC(0-168)ss]
outcomeMeasures.description: PK: Area Under the Concentration Time Curve over a 1-week interval of Dulaglutide at Steady-State \[AUC(0-168)ss\] was derived by a population pharmacokinetics approach. As part of addendum, additional PK samples were taken at week 9.
